This entirely depends on what exactly you do in retail, when you start, what sort of raises you get etc. I used to work in retail, I started in high school and worked it through college and a bit beyond. By that time I was making around $15 an hour and that was around the time of the recession. For that time it was a decent amount of money (I actually made a decent side profit because I had money to invest in things few could buy when they lost their jobs). Keep in mind I was just a run of the mill employee, so had I chosen to stick with retail I probably eventually would have gone into management and made far more. If you intend to make a living doing it keep in mind what the lowest paying positions are when applying and realize the hours and shifts are pretty lousy. It’s generally a good job to have during college or similar because most retailers have flexible hours.

Now a days online store is in trend just because it has vast profitability with less marketing cost. It reduces your extra cost on marketing, physical space, furniture cost and man power, and this is more effective than offline retail shop or store, but it really depends on you that which kind of shop you have or you gonna start.
Any retail business that can generate 50% or more of profits from the capital employed is good retail business. Remember to subtract your workers salary but not yours.

It depends on what the position in retail you have. Managers and Assistant Managers make a decent living. The other positions would probably need a additional job or a significant others income to have a modest living.
